image.altText: A large bin parked in a carpark outside a childcare facility

props.synopsis: A former employee of childcare provider Genius Education says the company owes staff thousands in unpaid superannuation and workers were not able to say a proper goodbye to the children they cared for.

title.children: Worker claims childcare company owes staff thousands of dollars in super

image.altText: A white flash of lightning with a dark background

props.synopsis: Country Fire Service crews have spent the night responding to scrub fires, as a severe thunderstorm rolled across SA's South East, leaving thousands without power.

title.children: Sleepless night for SA firefighters as dry lightning sparks close to 100 fires

image.altText: A woman holding a nail gun on a construction site

props.synopsis: As Australia's construction industry continues to suffer from a worker shortage, some female tradies say more women want to take up the tools but are prevented by sexist attitudes on the job site.

title.children: Chippy loves her trade, but says sexist remarks are a barrier for women

image.altText: A cave diver wearing a yellow helmet, blue mask and black wetsuit squeezes between rocks.

props.synopsis: Curious divers on South Australia's Limestone Coast are hoping to one day be able to dive into one cave and come out another, after discovering an underground tunnel.

title.children: Cave divers' push to unexplored territory uncovers 100m tunnel

image.altText: A wind turbine, as seen from close proximity, towering above bushland where other turbines stand.

props.synopsis: Residents in the south-west Victorian town of Nelson say building the some of the biggest wind turbines in Australia will harm the look and environment of the picturesque area.

title.children: 270m-high wind turbine plan generates opposition in Victorian town

image.altText: Mount Torrens dairy farmers Rodney Herrmann and Ben Wilhelm stand on dry and cracked ground, in front of a small dam

props.synopsis: Mount Torrens dairy farmers Rodney Herrmann and Ben Wilhelm say they would be "in big trouble" if they were not able to pump water from a neighbour's dam. They are calling on the state government to provide more support for farmers enduring the current drought conditions.

title.children: SA farmers 'battling through some of the toughest times I can remember'

image.altText: A guard tower in a correctional centre behind razor wire.

props.synopsis: Police are appealing for public assistance to help locate a 28-year-old man who escaped from Broken Hill Correctional Centre on Sunday.

title.children: Police hunt inmate who escaped outback correctional centre

image.altText: A prison fence and security camera

props.synopsis: SA's Public Service Association has called for urgent reform, claiming three prisoners have been violently assaulted by other inmates in the past week — with each incident resulting in hospitalisations.

title.children: Prisoner in hospital after third violent attack in week, SA union says

image.altText: Tom Campbell poses with a football at the MCG after signing with Melbourne

props.synopsis: They're the backbone of every sporting team, the bench players who spend months or even years waiting to get their moment in the spotlight.

title.children: Here's to bench warmers, the unsung heroes of sporting teams

image.altText: Five children sit on a fence with a sign that reads 'Devonborough Downs'., wear hats, sky with white clouds, brown earth.

props.synopsis: Families on remote outback stations say they've been left in the lurch after a student boarding house closed suddenly.

title.children: Outback parents scramble to find accommodation after hostel closure

image.altText: A mother plays with her kid, drawing at a table.

props.synopsis: Domestic violence and child protection workers could leave if South Australia pushes ahead with proposed guidelines for a national-first social worker registration scheme, advocates are warning.

title.children: Concerns 'children could die' under proposed details for social worker registration scheme

image.altText: Smoke billowing from steelworks into a cloudy sky

props.synopsis: When the new administrators of the Whyalla steelworks arrived on site two weeks ago, one of the first things they noticed was the traffic lights on the way in weren't working — as they looked over its assets and finances, things only got worse.

title.children: Administrators 'shocked' by the state of Whyalla's steelworks

image.altText: Smiling woman in black one-piece bathers in waist deep clear ocean water holding a bucket and a phone up

props.synopsis: An amateur fisherman's ingenious plan to use his phone to monitor his fishing reel backfired when it floated out to sea in a bucket. He couldn't believe his luck when the phone turned up three days later.

title.children: Phone lost at sea turns up after floating for three days and 20km in bucket

image.altText: Steve Gillis looks ahead wearing a black polo shirt as he stands on a golf course

props.synopsis: Steve Gillis spent months trying to find answers to the "constant companions" of tinnitus, brain fog and visual disturbances that followed him after he had recovered from a virus. Now there are hopes others with visual snow syndrome will face an easier path to diagnosis.

title.children: 'Huge relief' for visual snow syndrome patients after WHO inclusion

image.altText: A woman makes moonshine in Bihar, India.

props.synopsis: A ban on alcohol created to protect women from domestic violence in India's Bihar has bred a criminal underworld.

title.children: A state with 130 million people banned booze. It unleashed chaos

image.altText: People holding protest signs about Tesla and Elon Musk outside a Tesla showroom.

props.synopsis: From protests at more than 50 Tesla showrooms across the US, and bumper stickers on Australian Teslas from embarrassed owners, to cheeky UK bus stop advertisements critical of boss Elon Musk — the criticism and condemnation appears to be gathering pace.

title.children: 'Dump Tesla': Protests target showrooms as sales slump hits stock

image.altText: White rectangular, concrete building with glass windows and brown glass entrance way and blue sky.

props.synopsis: With a federal election on the horizon in May, both the opposition and intelligence analysts have warned that there's a risk the report will remain buried forever.

title.children: Fears intelligence report will remain buried forever as election approaches

image.altText: Professor Richard Scolyer

props.synopsis: Former Australian of the Year Richard Scolyer says he is heartbroken to reveal his brain cancer has returned after revolutionary treatment kept the aggressive tumour at bay for more than 18 months.

title.children: 'I'm not ready to die': Professor Richard Scolyer's heartbreaking prognosis

image.altText: An intricate golden star shape above capital letters that spell out "The Star" advertising a casino.

props.synopsis: Against all odds, Star Entertainment has managed to avoid sliding into administration for now. But its near demise poses bigger problems for a glittering world that risks being consigned to a bygone era.

title.children: A former pro poker player, Star's CEO has pulled off a stone-cold bluff

image.altText: Woman stands in front of sandbags with arms crossed

props.synopsis: The Lockyer Valley, about 120 kilometres west of Brisbane, is being hit with the effects of ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred, with some communities ordered to evacuate.

title.children: Lockyer Valley residents watch as front yards become an 'ocean'

image.altText: The Stena Immaculate, a large commercial shipping vessel, sitting at a dock.

props.synopsis: Authorities say 36 people were brought to shore after the incident off the north-eastern coast of England.

title.children: Tanker hired by US military ablaze off UK coast after strike by container ship

image.altText: A man wearing a black shirt with a white logo that says "DOGE" shows it off to the camera smiling

props.synopsis: The owner of X has announced the incident on his own platform after users around the world reported issues on the site.

title.children: Elon Musk says X outages due to 'massive cyberattack'

image.altText: Trump-Turnbull teaser box image

props.synopsis: The US president's social media broadside came after Mr Turnbull criticised him on US television.

title.children: 'Bipartisan gaslighting': Turnbull reacts to Trump's personal attack

image.altText: Woman with cup in hand sits on couch with laptop on lap at home

props.synopsis: Suddenly, working from home is being debated in Canberra. But who benefits if it becomes an election issue?

title.children: Working from home is popular, as an election issue it could backfire

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Supporters of impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol wave US and South Korean flags.

props.synopsis: Wearing symbolic white helmets and waving "Stop the Steal" flags, the young men of the "white skull squad" are back on the streets of South Korea and wanting the US to intervene in their country's democracy.

title.children: Young men are fuelling the rise of the 'White Skull Squad' in Korea

image.altText: A pontoon tipped over into a river.

props.synopsis: Australia's east coast has been pounded by rain, wind and surf for a week, with Brisbane recording its highest daily rainfall in half a century.

title.children: Brisbane records heaviest rain since Cyclone Wanda

image.altText: Slim and Albo

props.synopsis: Lismore SES crew leader Neville Graham asked for a "personal selfie" with the prime minister, then got back to work protecting homes.

title.children: Selfie with PM then back to work for SES

props.synopsis: Former NSW treasurer Matt Kean has slammed his own party over its advocacy of nuclear power, calling plans to subsidise nuclear reactors "nonsense".

title.children: 'Like building a Blockbuster': Liberal slams party's nuclear plan

image.altText: Virat Kohli holds up Champions Trophy as teammates celebrate

props.synopsis: India's triumph at the 2025 Champions Trophy is the crowning moment for the world's best white ball team. Sadly, many won't see it that way, through no fault of the players themselves, writes Chris de Silva.

title.children: India's Champions Trophy win a tainted one despite team's dominance

image.altText: Two middle-aged men, one in a tight, olive green shirt and the other in a suit, shake hands in front of a woooden wall.

props.synopsis: Russia has told Australia there will be "grave consequences" if it puts "boots on the ground" in Ukraine as part of a Western peacekeeping operation proposed by UK Prime Minister Kier Starmer.

title.children: Russia warns Australia of 'grave consequences' if it sends peacekeepers to Ukraine

image.altText: A man with a long beard, wearing a navy jumper.

props.synopsis: The man accused of murdering 24-year-old Cairns woman Toyah Cordingley likely contributed to DNA on a stick found at her burial site, but not on the lead of her dog which was found tied tightly to a tree nearby.

title.children: DNA at Toyah Cordingley's burial site 3.7b times more likely to be accused's than another's, court hears

image.altText: Two road signs above a flooded roadway, only their tops visible

props.synopsis: It is deja vu for Queensland residents as they work to save property from ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred rainfall.

title.children: Residents cut off in Logan area as flooding starts to block roads and bridges
